Authors: Che-Chih Chen, Sheng-Hua Wu, Chi-Yu Chen
Title:
Xylodon subflaviporus sp. nov. (Hyphodontia s.l.,
Basidiomycota) from East Asia
Abstract:
Xylodon subflaviporus (Hyphodontia s.l., Schizoporaceae,
Hymenochaetales, Basidiomycota) is described as a new species collected
from tropical and subtropical regions of East Asia. This new species is
characterized by resupinate basidiocarps, a poroid hymenophore,
pseudodimitic hyphal system, nodose-septate hyphae, four types of
cystidia (capitate, acicular to cylindrical, subulate to ventricose, and
apically-encrusted), and thin-walled, colorless, smooth and ellipsoid
basidiospores. Both Bayesian and Maximum Parsimony algorithms were used
to construct phylogenies inferred from the internal transcribed spacer
(ITS) region of rDNA. Morphological and molecular studies, along with
intercompatibility tests, confirmed the independent status of this
species. A key to known species of Hyphodontia s.l. with poroid,
irpicoid or raduloid hymenophores is provided for the convenience in
identification.
